title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.22 - Pressurized vessels
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.22 - Pressurized vessels

State Regulations
(a) Pressurized
vessels (aerosol or similar type containers) containing a flammable liquid
mixture (flash point at or below 80 degrees Fahrenheit), a combustible liquid
mixture (flash point above 80 degrees Fahrenheit and at or below 150 degrees

Fahrenheit) or a liquefied flammable compressed propellant gas are prohibited
from entering either a tunnel, the George Washington Bridge Lower Level or the

George Washington Bridge Expressway unless such vessel or container be of
metal, of 19.3 fluid ounces capacity or less, and has an absolute pressure of
75 pounds or less, and when so packed in an outside container, the quantity of
the total load shall not exceed 4,000 pounds gross weight per
vehicle. (b) Vessels containing
non-dangerous materials that are propelled by non-flammable compressed gases
are not restricted, regardless of quantity or size of
containers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21

1211.22

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
